channel.title: Weiyu Chen's Personal Website
channel.description: Recent content on Weiyu Chen's Personal Website

item.title: Weiyu Chen
item.description:
Welcome!

About Me

Hello! I’m Weiyu Chen, a fourth-year computer science student at Fuzhou University. I am passionate about deep learning and artificial intelligence. I’m currently preparing to apply for a master’s program in computer science to further deepen my knowledge and research in these cutting-edge fields.

  • Interests: Recommender Systems, Medical Image Analysis, Face Recognition & Person Re-ID
  • Career Goals: To publish high-quality research papers in reputable journals and conferences while pursuing a master’s degree in computer science, with a focus on advancing my expertise in deep learning and its applications.

Education

  • B.S. in Computer Science, Fuzhou University, 2021 - 2025
    • Relevant Courses: Advanced Artificial Intelligence, Technology of Data Mining, Pattern Recognition, Computer Graphics, Computer Organization and Architecture, Operating Systems
    • Awards and Honors:
      • Awarded the Second-Class Scholarship of the university
      • Twice awarded the Third-Class Scholarship of the School
      • Received the Progress Award once
      • Recognized as an Outstanding Individual in the College for three academic years (2021, 2022, 2023)

Skills

Programming Languages: C/C++, Python
Deep Learning Frameworks: TensorFlow, PyTorch
Machine Learning Libraries: Scikit-learn
Data Analysis Tools: NumPy, Pandas, Matplotlib
Big Data Technologies: Spark, Flink, Kafka, Cassandra
Backend Frameworks and Tools: Flask, FastAPI
Frontend Technologies: Vue3, Ajax
Databases: MySQL, Neo4j
Version Control: Git

Research and Publications

Masked Theme-Specific Named Entity Recognition Assisted with Large Language Models

  • Description: Co-authored a paper that proposes an effective two-stage approach for named entity recognition using masked theme-specific methods associated with large language models. This approach leverages an unsupervised mechanism rather than a supervised one, enhancing the efficiency of NER tasks.
    Ying Zhao, Weiyu Chen, Longlong Liao, et al., “Masked Theme-Specific Named Entity Recognition Assisted with Large Language Models,” 2024 IEEE International Conference on Computing (ICOCO 2024), Accepted.

Brain Tumor Diagnosis with Deep Separable Convolutional Networks

  • Description: Researched and developed a model for brain tumor classification, achieving a 97.41% accuracy rate using deep separable convolutional networks and attention mechanisms.
    Weiyu Chen, Peiyao Sun, and Yujia Zhang, “A brain tumor diagnosis approach based on deep separable convolutional networks and attention mechanisms,” Applied and Computational Engineering, vol. 67, no. 1, pp. 60-69, Jul. 2024, doi: 10.54254/2755-2721/67/20240629.

Projects

Project 1: Neural Graph Collaborative Filtering-based Parking Space Recommendation System

  • Description: Developed a parking space recommendation system based on neural graph collaborative filtering to provide personalized parking space suggestions.
  • Technologies Used: PyTorch, Neo4j, Pandas, Flask+Vue
  • Contribution: Project leader responsible for overseeing system development and the implementation of the recommendation algorithm.

Project 2: Video Identity Recognition

  • Description: Worked on the integration of face recognition and person re-identification technologies to enhance the accuracy of identification in surveillance systems.
  • Core Idea: Integration of Face Recognition and Person Re-identification
  • Contribution: Conducted research and development of the integrated identity recognition system, enhancing its ability to identify individuals under varying conditions. Plan to integrate this method into a Multimodal Big-data Analysis System for Research Efficiency, aiming to implement it in a laboratory setting to replace fingerprint clock-in with an automatic camera-based clock-in function.

Project 3: Traffic Scene Object Detection Based on MMDetection

  • Description: The core objective of the project is to accurately and comprehensively detect all specified objects in traffic scene images by making adjustments in areas such as model selection, data augmentation, and loss function optimization.

Project 4: Single-Page Application for Object Detection Model Evaluation and Result Display Based on PyScript+Vue

  • Description: Developed a pure front-end single-page application that uses PyScript to execute Python code and implements the mAP value evaluation function of the object detection model.
  • Designed System: Link

Project 5: Campus Network Management Platform Based on SDN Global Control

  • Description: Utilized Python and flow table issuance for precise control over specific data packets, thereby simulating the management of university campus networks to meet the needs of network management, measurement, and analysis processes.

Internship Experience

AI Development Engineer, Data Security Product Department, China Telecom FuFu Information Technology Co., Ltd.

  • Duration: July 2024 - November 2024

  • Researched the architecture of the User & Entity Behavior Analytics (UEBA) system

    • Analyzed technologies used in modern UEBA systems
    • Explored technical implementation methods and application scenarios
    • Summarized effective strategies and improvement methods

  • Generated pre-training data for large language model-based Q&A systems

    • Focused on security assessments of new internet technologies and services

  • Expanded knowledge of common machine learning algorithms

    • Emphasized practical applications in network traffic processing and log auditing

Contact

  • Email: chenweiyu0315@foxmail.com or durian_cwy@163.com
